results.title: Acid from heaven
results.creator_credit: George Mully and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Many years ago there was a popular song suggesting that each time it rained it rained pennies from heaven. Today’s reality is that when it rains, it rains acid from heaven. By re-enacting a case study of a person whose income was cut off as a direct result of acid rain, this presentation, composed of still photo montage, provides in laymen’s terms some basic information about this little-known form of pollution.

results.title: According to the evidence
results.brief_description: Scenes in a committal hearing and in court with a jury are created and structured to present, for the benefit of law students, the problems, laws and precedents regarding the nature and admissibility of evidence

results.title: Accidents don't happen. Ch. 5: safe clothing
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Brogan thinks Foreman McCardle has gone clean off his rocker when he has him, Brogan, carted away to the clinic although he’s perfectly well. When Nurse Gilfillan starts to operate - on Brogan’s trailing necktie, baggy-sleeved sweater, cuffed pants and worn-out shoes - horrid tales of workers who had worn similar clothing and been reduced to near-hamburger make everything quite clear. Cast: Joseph Carr, Marcia Diamond, Alfie Scopp

results.title: Accidents don't happen. Ch. 4: falls
results.creator_credit: Donald Mulholland, Fred Lasse and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spotlights the most common causes of serious falls in industry. While an ironic commentary suggests new and better ways of tripping people up, we see workers drop truck handles in the aisles, neglect loose floor boards, leave pails on stairs, climb on rickety boxes, and use an extension ladder without safety feet. The film ends with practical advice on how to eliminate factory danger spots that may result in bad falls.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Mulholland, Fred Lasse and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Pat Crawley, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The subject is the actual crash of a small plane in which one man survived to tell the story. What he describes is his view of the world now, after being on the edge of death. It is, he says, like being continually stoned - neutral but more fully aware, accepting life without bias, a condition he feels we are all coming to. Award: New York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Duckworth, Pat Crawley, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Accident prevention: look before you leap
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: That this number one safety rule has special application to vacationers is illustrated in this animated film which tells the story of a cyclist who didn’t look before he leaped. After pedalling uphill to a precipitous cliff he decided he’d like to cool off in the inviting water below, and dived right in without first looking. The result - one less cyclist, and one more statistic to support the warning: “Dive only into deep water.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Abraham Lincoln
results.creator_credit: Donald Davis, Dorothy Mathews, Paul Nickell and Westinghouse Studio One
results.brief_description: Television adaptation of English playwright and poet John Drinkwater’s play “Abraham Lincoln” which features a cameo role towards the end of the program by James Dean as a reluctant Union soldier sentenced to death for sleeping on guard duty. This live television drama documents a part of Lincoln’s life from his nomination for presidency through to his attendance at Ford’s Theater where his eventual assassination took place. Stars Robert Pastene as Abraham Lincoln and Judith Evelyn as Mary Lincoln. Also includes classic Westinghouse ad-breaks at intervals throughout the program. NB: Picture quality and sound is variable.

results.title: About a dollar's worth
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Department of Defence, Defence Public Relations
results.brief_description: Employs constructive montage and synthetic music to illustrate the benefits of the Royal Australian Air Force to Australians. Looks at training of personnel, rescue work, training of overseas personnel, and social activities.

results.title: Aboriginal culture
results.creator_credit: Jerome Levy, Keith Gow, Norma Disher and Link Films
results.brief_description: The legends of Wayamba the turtle and Bohra the kangaroo retold by animated sketches based on the motifs of aboriginal bark paintings. An introductory sequence shows something of the variety and skill in aboriginal decorative art. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Abnormal behavior: a mental hospital (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Neil Reichline, Tom Lazarus and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: A series of doctor-patient interviews acquaint the viewer with the symptomatology of various types of schizophrenic disturbances. In an unusual sequence, a patient with paranoid tendencies is shown undergoing electro-convulsive therapy. The director of the hospital tells of the hospital’s goals in this and other forms of treatment.
